00012 char prompt_str[MAX_LINE]       = "MPX> "; 
00013 char *welcome_message_str       = "\n\n  Welcome to Perpetual Motion Squad's Operating System.\n\n    (type `help commands`) for a list of available commands.)\n\n";  
00014 char *anykey_str                = "\n<<Press Enter to Continue.>>";
00017 mpx_cmd_t *cmd_head = NULL;
00018 
00019 
00020 void mpx_add_command( char *cmd_name, void(*cmd_function)(int argc, char *argv[]) ) {
00021 
00022         /* allocate a command object */
00023         mpx_cmd_t *command = (mpx_cmd_t*) sys_alloc_mem( sizeof(mpx_cmd_t) ); /* FIXME need to check for error from alloc func. */
00024 
00025         /* allocate and populate the command name member. */
00026         command->cmd_name = sys_alloc_mem( strlen(cmd_name)+1 );
00027         strcpy( command->cmd_name, cmd_name );
00028 
00029         /* populate the command function member. */
00030         command->cmd_function = cmd_function;
00031 
00032         /* be sure to set the next-command pointer member to NULL, since this will be the new last command. */
00033         command->next = NULL;
00034 
00035         /* add the command to the global list of commands. */
00036         if ( cmd_head == NULL ) {
00037                 cmd_head = command;
00038         } else {
00039                 mpx_cmd_t *last_command = cmd_head;
00040                 while ( last_command->next != NULL ) {
00041                         last_command = last_command->next;
00042                 }
00043                 last_command->next = command;
00044         }
00045 }
00046 
00050 int mpx_command_loop (void) {
00051 
00052         char cmd_line[MAX_LINE];
00053         char *cmd_argv[MAX_ARGS+1];
00054         int  cmd_argc;
00055         int  i;
00056         mpx_cmd_t *command;
00057 
00058         mpx_add_command( "help", mpxcmd_help );
00059         mpx_add_command("load", mpxcmd_load );
00060         mpx_add_command("date", mpxcmd_date );
00061         mpx_add_command("exit", mpxcmd_exit );
00062         mpx_add_command("create",mpxcmd_create_PCB);
00063         mpx_add_command("delete",mpxcmd_delete_PCB);
00064         mpx_add_command("block",mpxcmd_block);
00065         mpx_add_command("unblock",mpxcmd_unblock);
00066         mpx_add_command("suspend",mpxcmd_suspend);
00067         mpx_add_command("resume",mpxcmd_resume);
00068         mpx_add_command("setPriority",mpxcmd_setPriority);
00069         mpx_add_command("show",mpxcmd_show_PCB);
00070         mpx_add_command("showAll",mpxcmd_showAll_PCB);
00071         mpx_add_command("showReady",mpxcmd_showReady_PCB);
00072         mpx_add_command("showBlocked",mpxcmd_showBlocked_PCB);
00073 
00074         for(;;){ /* infinite loop */
00075 
00076                 mpx_cls();
00077 
00078                 printf("%s", welcome_message_str);
00079 
00080                 printf("%s", prompt_str);
00081 
00082                 cmd_argc = 0;
00083 
00084                 mpx_readline(cmd_line, MAX_LINE-1);     
00085 
00086                 cmd_argv[0] = strtok(cmd_line, " ");
00087                 cmd_argc++;
00088 
00089                 /* cmd_line is invalidated after this point; use cmd_argv[] instead. */
00090 
00091                 for(i=0; i<MAX_ARGS; i++){
00092                         cmd_argv[cmd_argc] = strtok(NULL, " ");
00093                         if( cmd_argv[cmd_argc] == NULL ){
00094                                 break;
00095                         }
00096                         cmd_argc++;
00097                 }
00098 
00099                 /* handle too-many-args error condition. */
00100                 if (i == MAX_ARGS && strtok(NULL, " ") != NULL) {
00101                         printf("ERROR: Argument list too long.\n");
00102                         printf("%s", anykey_str); mpxprompt_anykey();
00103                         continue;
00104                 }
00105 
00106                 /* run the command function that the user requested,
00107                  * or print an error message if it is not valid. */
00108                 command = cmd_head;
00109                 while (command != NULL) {
00110                         if ( strcmp(command->cmd_name, cmd_argv[0]) == 0 ) {
00111                                 command->cmd_function( cmd_argc, cmd_argv );
00112                                 break;
00113                         }
00114                         command = command->next;
00115                 }
00116 
00117                 /* if we did not find the requested command in the list of commands,
00118                  * print an appropriate error message. */
00119                 if ( command == NULL ) {
00120                          printf("Invalid command.\n");
00121                          printf("%s", anykey_str); mpxprompt_anykey();
00122                 }
00123         }
00124 }

00128 void mpxcmd_load (int argc, char *argv[]) {
00129         char buf[10];
00130         char line_buf[MAX_LINE];
00131         long file_size;
00132         int  num_mpx_files = 0;
00133 
00134         mpx_cls();
00135 
00136         if( sys_open_dir(NULL) != 0 ){
00137                 printf("WARNING: Failed to open MPX directory!\n");
00138                 printf("%s", anykey_str); mpxprompt_anykey();
00139                 return;
00140         }
00141 
00142         mpx_pager_init("  Contents of MPX Directory (.mpx Files):\n  =======================================\n    SIZE        NAME\n    ----------  -------------------------------------------\n");
00143         while( sys_get_entry(buf, 9, &file_size) == 0 ){
00144                 /* snprintf(&line_buf, MAX_LINE, "    %10ld  %s", file_size, buf); */
00145                 sprintf(&line_buf, "    %10ld  %s", file_size, buf);
00146                 mpx_pager(&line_buf);
00147                 num_mpx_files++;
00148         }
00149 
00150         sys_close_dir();
00151 
00152         if (num_mpx_files == 0) {
00153                 printf("\n There aren't any .mpx files in the MPX directory!\n\n");
00154         }
00155 
00156         printf("%s", anykey_str); mpxprompt_anykey();
00157         return;
00158 }

00196 void mpxcmd_prompt (void) {
00197         printf("\n");
00198         printf("  Current prompt is: \"%s\"\n", prompt_str);
00199         printf("\n");
00200         printf("Enter new prompt: ");
00201         mpx_readline( prompt_str, MAX_LINE );
00202 
00203         printf("%s", anykey_str); mpxprompt_anykey();
00204         return;
00205 }

00208 void mpxcmd_date (int argc, char *argv[]) {
00209         date_rec date;
00210         sys_get_date(&date);
00211         printf("\n");
00212         printf("  System Date:\n");
00213         printf("    %2d/%2d/%4d\n", date.month, date.day, date.year);
00214         printf("   (mm/dd/yyyy)\n");
00215         printf("\n");
00216         printf("Change it (y/n)? ");
00217         if( mpxprompt_yn() ) {
00218                 int is_leapyear;
00219                 int max_days;
00220 
00221                 printf("\n");
00222 
00223                 printf("  New YEAR:  "); date.year      = mpxprompt_int();
00224                 if( !(date.year >=1900 && date.year < 10000) ){
00225                         /* invalid year entered. */
00226                         printf("\nInvalid year entered.\n");
00227                         printf("%s", anykey_str); mpxprompt_anykey();
00228                         return;
00229                 }
00230 
00231                 is_leapyear = ((date.year%4==0 && date.year%100!=0)||(date.year%400==0));
00232 
00233                 printf("  New MONTH: "); date.month     = mpxprompt_int();
00234 
00235                 switch (date.month) {
00236                         case 1:
00237                         case 3:
00238                         case 5:
00239                         case 7:
00240                         case 8:
00241                         case 10:
00242                         case 12:
00243                                 max_days = 31;
00244                         break;
00245 
00246                         case 4:
00247                         case 6:
00248                         case 9:
00249                         case 11:
00250                                 max_days = 30;
00251                         break;
00252 
00253                         case 2:
00254                                 if( is_leapyear ) {
00255                                         max_days = 29;
00256                                 } else {
00257                                         max_days = 28;
00258                                 }
00259                         break;
00260 
00261                         default:
00262                                 /* invalid month entered. */
00263                                 printf("\nInvalid month entered.\n");
00264                                 printf("%s", anykey_str); mpxprompt_anykey();
00265                                 return;
00266                         /* break;  commented out to prevent turbo c++ "unreachable code" warning. */
00267                 }
00268 
00269                 printf("  New DAY:   "); date.day       = mpxprompt_int();
00270 
00271                 if( !(date.day > 0 && date.day <= max_days) ){
00272                         /* invalid day entered. */
00273                         printf("\nInvalid day entered.\n");
00274                         printf("%s", anykey_str); mpxprompt_anykey();
00275                         return;
00276                 }
00277 
00278                 /* set the system date. */
00279                 if( sys_set_date(&date) == 0 ){
00280                         printf("Date successfully set!\n");
00281                 } else {
00282                         printf("WARNING:\n");
00283                         printf("sys_set_date() returned error.\n");
00284                         printf("Date may not have been set.\n");
00285                 }
00286                 printf("%s", anykey_str); mpxprompt_anykey();
00287         }
00288         return;
00289 }

00292 void mpxcmd_exit (int argc, char *argv[]) {
00293         printf("\n");
00294         printf("Are you sure you want to terminate MPX?\n");
00295         if( mpxprompt_yn() ) {
00296                 printf("EXITING.\n");
00297                 sys_exit();
00298         }
00299 }
